question: 息子
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>breath</kanji> <kanji>child</kanji> (that lets you release your breath when it's born) is a <vocabulary>son</vocabulary>. Nowadays it's cool to have a girl, but back in the day you wanted a son to carry on your underwater basket weaving legacy. That's why this is a son.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading of this is messed up. <ja>子</ja> is <ja>こ</ja>, that should be okay. <ja>息</ja> is <ja>むす</ja> for some reason though. Why? Because you gave birth to a son, but he was a <reading>moose</reading> (<ja>むす</ja>). You better hold that breath again, because this is not what you wanted.
